author: Special Correspondent
text:
A day after Opposition parties took to the streets over the sting operation targeting Trinamool Congress leaders, the Congress and the BJP filed petitions in the Calcutta High Court on Wednesday, seeking an investigation by a Central government agency.

The Congress, the BJP and lawyer Akshay Sarengi filed public interest litigation petitions.

The petition filed by BJP leader Brajesh has sought an investigation by either the CBI or the ED.

“In our petition, we have made the Election Commission a party. Besides the probe, we want those who have allegedly taken money disqualified from contesting the Assembly polls,” Congress leader Amitava Chakraborty said.

Opposition and TMC councillors clashed at the Kolkata Municipal Corporation.

The Opposition members threw fake currency notes in the air.
title: Cong., BJP seek probe into TMC sting operation
